lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.
Well, I wouldn't run away, Miss Travers, because I know where you live.
Who are you?
Well, not the man who knows everything - just the man who knows the important things. You're important to me - that's why I know you.
I've never seen you before.
You will again.

[to Fernack referring to Val]
I mean how could a girl as pretty as that be so clever?
Why are you telling *me* all this?

Because... well... because I love you. But don't let's get sticky about it - I'm really a very shallow person. I also love fireflies, mocking-birds and pink sunsets. I think, however, that we could find each other more diverting than a pink sunset, don't you?

[Referring to Simon]
That fellow is notorious. You can't be serious.
He proved his worth in New York. Gentlemen, sometimes where there's gangrene, a red-hot iron is the best cure.
The telephone is perhaps one of man's most important contributions to the scheme of things.
What are you doing there?
Helping you unpack.
No you don't. You can't do that to me, Simon. I've got orders to go to San Francisco. and, by God, I'm going.
Thay's fine. I'll go along with you just to give you an excuse for going. I'll give myself an excuse to see a girl who's much too pretty to be clever.

[after Simon kisses Val and is slapped by her]
Mr. Templar!

[to Val]
I'm very sorry but under certain circumstances I simply can't resist the temptation to be a cad.
[Referring to Breck]
I can see by this gentleman's manner that he's never kissed you but, uh, would like to.
Get out if here!
As you get to know me better, you'll realize that I have moments of almost maudlin sentimentality. Actually we're quite bit alike. You could never live without adventure, and neither could I.
And remember you're allergic to shellfish.
Yes dear. I won't eat the shells. Betty, don't you ever think about the fact that I'm a lot more allergic to bullets.
